title: Sri Lanka faces near 4 hour power cut on Thursday
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s power regulator announced a power cut of up to 3 hour and 45 minutes for Thursday in all parts of the country between 8am and 11pm due to inadequate supply of fuel for thermal power generation.

According to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) power cut schedule approved for Thursday by the regulator Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL), group A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K and L areas will face 2.5-hour power cuts between 8am and 6pm and another 1 hour and 15 minutes between 6pm and 11pm.

For the T, U, V, W, R, S, P and Q groups, only 1-hour power cut will be imposed between 5pm and 9pm on Thursday. These groups were scheduled to face a 3-hour power cut in total between 9am to 9 pm on Wednesday.
The CEB said: “there will be extended power cuts throughout the day to limit further hydro drawdown without prior notice.”
The CEB said  Sojitz, Sapugaskanda B and Kelanitissa plants have enough fuel to run for 2.6 days,  1.7 days and 1.1 days respectively.
Other plants do not have enough fuel to run for another 12 hours.
CEB said there is a power deficit of 240 MW for the day peak, 260 MW for the evening peak and 275 MW for the night peak. (Colombo/ March 09/2022)
